item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 3, 2025 at 5:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Youth and what happens when it's gone (177 points | 86 comments)
2. Apple's Software Quality Crisis: When Premium Hardware Meets Subpar Software (154 points | 119 comments)
3. Show HN: Knowledge graph of restaurants and chefs, built using LLMs (50 points | 19 comments)
4. An Attempt to Catch Up with JIT Compilers (22 points | 16 comments)
5. Ask HN: Who is hiring? (March 2025) (53 points | 56 comments)
6. Keeling Labs (YC W23) Is Hiring an ML Engineer for Climate Tech (Los Angeles) ( | hide)
7. First flat telescope lens that captures color, detecting light from stars (18 points | 2 comments)
8. Ask HN: Freelancer? Seeking freelancer? (March 2025) (18 points | 33 comments)
9. The power of interning: making a time series database 2000x smaller in Rust (3 points | discuss)
10. Show HN: Agents.json – OpenAPI Specification for LLMs (3 points | discuss)
11. FlakeUI (73 points | 18 comments)
12. Firefly ‘Blue Ghost’ lunar lander touches down on the moon (682 points | 164 comments)
13. MIT 6.S184: Introduction to Flow Matching and Diffusion Models (258 points | 16 comments)
14. Made a scroll bar buddy that walks down the page when you scroll (519 points | 173 comments)
15. Number-Colour-Phoneme Associations: From IBM CGA Colours to Mnemonic Systems (13 points | 1 comment)
16. Man's brain turned to glass by hot Vesuvius ash cloud (172 points | 64 comments)
17. Drone Delivery for Defense (24 points | 26 comments)
18. The quest to find and save the Vasa (3 points | discuss)
19. Harvest the sun twice: Agrivoltaics promises sustainable food, energy and water (142 points | 78 comments)
20. AWS Cat Qubits Make Quantum Error Correction Effective, Affordable (29 points | 9 comments)
21. Virtual museum of socialist era graphic design in Bulgaria (92 points | 10 comments)
22. Show HN: Tangled – Git collaboration platform built on atproto (128 points | 9 comments)
23. Phlex for Rails Emails: Action Mailer Without ERB (57 points | 17 comments)
24. Speedrunners are vulnerability researchers, they just don't know it yet (337 points | 82 comments)
25. Hallucinations in code are the least dangerous form of LLM mistakes (334 points | 259 comments)
26. The Pentium contains a complicated circuit to multiply by three (348 points | 136 comments)
27. Geothermal power is a climate moon shot beneath our feet (276 points | 273 comments)
28. Amazon’s delivery drones are grounded in College Station, Texas (81 points | 224 comments)
29. Smallpond – A lightweight data processing framework built on DuckDB and 3FS (293 points | 66 comments)
30. Gooey rubber that's slowly ruining old hard drives (259 points | 177 comments)
